head.title: Metro Business; New Pacific Ship Service

identified-content.location: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; New Pacific Ship Service

abstract.p: Shanghai-based shipping firm Yu Gu He embarks on new all-water service between Port of New York and Asia via Panama Canal (S)

block.p: When the Shanghai-based Yu Gu He shipping firm's container ship left the Elizabeth Marine Terminal with a full load bound for Asian ports yesterday, it kicked off the line's new all-water service between the Port of New York and Asia via the Panama Canal.

When the Shanghai-based Yu Gu He shipping firm's container ship left the Elizabeth Marine Terminal with a full load bound for Asian ports yesterday, it kicked off the line's new all-water service between the Port of New York and Asia via the Panama Canal.

The new service is an alternative to the practice of Asian shippers of shipping cargo bound for East Coast at West Coast ports, then sending it across the country by rail, according to Howard Finkel, vice president of Cosco North America, which is the Chinese shipper's American subsidiary, The all-water route is expected to cut the transit time between New York and Hong Kong from 33 to 26 days.
